## Description {#details}

Streaming machine code generation interface.

This interface is intended to provide a programmatic interface that is very similar to the level that an assembler .s file provides. It has callbacks to emit bytes, handle directives, etc. The implementation of this interface retains state to know what the current section is etc.

There are multiple implementations of this interface: one for writing out a .s file, and implementations that write out .o files of various formats.

Definition at line 213 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcstreamer-h">MCStreamer.h</a>.

### emitCVFileDirective() {#a33c2e7b8c7463f2698a3132452cc4d12}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MCStreamer::emitCVFileDirective (unsigned FileNo, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Filename, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Checksum, unsigned ChecksumKind)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>

### emitWinCFIFuncletOrFuncEnd() {#aac38128831e5c5377b98fd32d4f53fc9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitWinCFIFuncletOrFuncEnd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> Loc=<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a>())</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This is used on platforms, such as Windows on ARM64, that require function or funclet sizes to be emitted in .xdata before the End marker is emitted for the frame.

We cannot use the End marker, as it is not set at the point of emitting .xdata, in order to indicate that the frame is active.

### AddComment {#a64eafd6bed9f342e423e74a93223135c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual void llvm::MCStreamer::AddComment (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; T, bool EOL=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Add a textual comment.

Typically for comments that can be emitted to the generated .s file if applicable as a QoI issue to make the output of the compiler more readable. This only affects the MCAsmStreamer, and only when verbose assembly output is enabled.

If the comment includes embedded 

&#39;s, they will each get the comment prefix as appropriate. The added comment should not end with a 

. By default, each comment is terminated with an end of line, i.e. the EOL param is set to true by default. If one prefers not to end the comment with a new line then the EOL param should be passed with a false value.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcstreamer-h/#l00366">366</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcstreamer-h">MCStreamer.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Add explicit comment T.

T is required to be a valid comment in the output and does not need to be escaped.

  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitRawComment (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; T, bool TabPrefix=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Print T and prefix it with the comment string (normally #) and optionally a tab.

This prints the comment immediately, not at the end of the current line. It is basically a safe version of EmitRawText: since it only prints comments, the object streamer ignores it instead of asserting.

### emitAssignment {#a04736ef5753e5ecda3c29ce902094e68}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitAssignment (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42; Symbol, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; Value)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit an assignment of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> to <code>Symbol</code>.

This corresponds to an assembler statement such as: symbol = value

The assignment generates no code, but has the side effect of binding the value in the current context. For the assembly streamer, this prints the binding into the .s file.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Symbol">- The symbol being assigned to.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/value&quot;>Value</a>">- The value for the symbol.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### emitCodeAlignment {#aa1dcf543ae68792dfaabeaa31f4ddef2}

  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit nops until the byte alignment <code>ByteAlignment</code> is reached.

This used to align code where the alignment bytes may be executed. This can emit different bytes for different sizes to optimize execution.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">

<ParametersListItem name="STI">- The <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsubtargetinfo">MCSubtargetInfo</a> in operation when padding is emitted.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxBytesToEmit">- The maximum numbers of bytes to emit, or 0. If the alignment cannot be reached in this many bytes, no bytes are emitted.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### emitValueImpl {#ae3d6e5ea7b855357014a16db766dddfd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitValueImpl (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42; Value, unsigned Size, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a> Loc=<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smloc">SMLoc</a>())</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit the expression <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> into the output as a native integer of the given <code>Size</code> bytes.

This is used to implement assembler directives such as .word, .quad, etc.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/value&quot;>Value</a>">- The value to emit.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="Size">- The size of the integer (in bytes) to emit. This must match a native machine width.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc&quot;>Loc</a>">- The location of the expression for error reporting.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

### emitValueToAlignment {#a9488c32df3cb8819f6a07f8c88d72c66}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitValueToAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment, int64&#95;t Value=0, unsigned ValueSize=1, unsigned MaxBytesToEmit=0)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Emit some number of copies of <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code> until the byte alignment <code>ByteAlignment</code> is reached.

If the number of bytes need to emit for the alignment is not a multiple of <code>ValueSize</code>, then the contents of the emitted fill bytes is undefined.

This used to implement the .align assembler directive.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Alignment">- The alignment to reach.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="<a href=&quot;/docs/api/classes/llvm/value&quot;>Value</a>">- The value to use when filling bytes.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="ValueSize">- The size of the integer (in bytes) to emit for <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a></code>. This must match a native machine width.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="MaxBytesToEmit">- The maximum numbers of bytes to emit, or 0. If the alignment cannot be reached in this many bytes, no bytes are emitted.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcstreamer-h/#l00846">846</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mc/mcstreamer-h">MCStreamer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcstreamer-cpp/#l01276">1276</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/mcstreamer-cpp">MCStreamer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### emitZeros {#ae77a5b8d3af591a461aeac723de33240}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void MCStreamer::emitZeros (uint64&#95;t NumBytes)</>}>
Emit NumBytes worth of zeros.

The implementation in this class just redirects to emitFill.

This function properly handles data in virtual sections.
